With the stakes high in an election year, South Africa’s ruling party sought to play up its achievements in the 25 years it has been in power.
Party president Cyril Ramaphosa delivered the party’s traditional “January 8th statement” which this year marks the organisation's 107th birthday.
This fact-check interrogates eight claims Ramaphosa made in his speech.
“Despite economic challenges over the last few years, our economy has tripled in size over the last 25 years. ”
“ Seven million more people are now employed today, than were employed in 1994.”
“In 1994 only three out of 10 people in South Africa had electricity…”
“...today eight out of 10 South Africans have electricity in their home.”
“Nine out of 10 South Africans today… have clean running water.”
“More than 4.3 million South Africans who are living with HIV receive antiretroviral treatment, making it the biggest programme in the whole world.”
“ More South Africans are living longer with average life expectancy increasing to 64 years in 2018 from a low of 53 years in 2005.”
